item.title: About Honeynet UNAMex Team
item.description:
Honeynet UNAMex

Who are we?

Honeynet UNAMex is a cybersecurity research group organized by volunteers with diverse background such as DFIR, Threat Hunting, System Administration, Threat Intel and Cyber-Deception/Honeypots.

Our team is based in Mexico and The Netherlands. Members and collaborators come from well-known organizations (such as former UNAM-CERT and Honeynet Project UNAM-Chapter) and from the industry on active roles within Cybersecurity.

Our main focus areas are:

  • Deception/Honeypot research and development
  • Threat Detection Engineering
  • Network Security
  • Network Forensics
  • Malware analysis

As you may read below in the history of the team, even though this is a new chapter starting in 2025, the background of our team comes back from the early 2000s.

item.title: Honeypot and Deception
item.description:
Honeynet and Deception initiative

Stay tuned. We will be posting details of our current projects.

In a nutshell, we will be working on:

  • Honeypot network deployment within academic networks and other locations
  • Development of new versions of the outdated/legacy tools developed during UNAM-Chapter era
  • Research, testing and development of new tooling with the new honeypot/deception trends

item.title: Blog
item.description:
@tailwindcss/typography

View on GitHub!

Beautiful typographic defaults for HTML you don’t control.

The official Tailwind CSS Typography plugin provides a set of prose classes you can use to add beautiful typographic defaults to any vanilla HTML you don’t control, like HTML rendered from Markdown, or pulled from a CMS.

Tailwind CSS IntelliSense extension for Visual Studio Code

<article class="prose lg:prose-xl">
  {{ markdown }}
</article>

To see what it looks like in action, check out our live demo on Tailwind Play. ​
